displayName.text: The African American Day Parade, Inc.

formattedAddress: 111th Street - 136th Street, Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10039, USA
adrFormatAddress: 111th Street - 136th Street, Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10039, USA

originalText.text: The African American Day Parade is always fun I've been going here for over 20 years and it is still fun. They have a lot of bands coming in from Maryland to represent the marching bands and the cheerleaders as well and that's always been a treat to see. I just wish that they would have all of the city organizations and NYPD and FDNY groups march last. Only because most of the people that are there are there to see the marching bands or dare to see the dance groups they're not there to see NYPD and FDNY march and they take up most of the time they're the biggest groups and a lot of people end up leaving 2 hours in because 2 hours in we're still looking at city organizations march. But overall it's a great experience if you want to see African American culture and if you're looking for an end of the summer activity with the kids.

originalText.text: Again Harlem treated last politicians you mess up. This parade not organized it was our day. You  had Mexican festivals  on 116 st for two days and  another parade German on Madison. You can't honor our day. You had no Porto for bathroom use for frustrated Ed children. This was the worst parade ever vendor set up treatment inhumane. Bus service info totally out of control bus operator frustrated rude no info given to passenger and very disrespectful.  O vote from me vote people them out of office

originalText.text:
It's a great parade,   it's time we as African Americans unite, we are more than a color but a culture of proud people. From the west indies to
America. #UnitedWeStand

originalText.text: A day for the American Blacks to celebrate our culture, contributions to the community and love one another.

text.text: A day for the American Blacks to celebrate our culture, contributions to the community and love one another.

originalText.text:
I for one enjoyed watching it and sometimes going to see it. I always love it
Do we still celebrate it, if so on what day is it celebrated
